optcom.equations.abstract_ampnlse module¶

class optcom.equations.abstract_ampnlse.AbstractAmpNLSE(re_fiber, gain_order, en_sat, R_0, R_L, temperature, GAIN_SAT, NOISE, split_noise_option, UNI_OMEGA, STEP_UPDATE)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_field_equation.AbstractFieldEquation

Parameters

  • re_fiber (AbstractREFiber) -- The rate equations describing the fiber laser dynamics.

  • gain_order -- The order of the gain coefficients to take into account.

  • en_sat -- The saturation energy. \([J]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(en_sat)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • R_0 -- The reflectivity at the fiber start. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • R_L -- The reflectivity at the fiber end. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • temperature -- The temperature of the medium. \([K]\)

  • GAIN_SAT -- If True, trigger the gain saturation.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • split_noise_option -- The way the spontaneous emission power is split among the fields.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update component parameters at each spatial space step by calling the _update_variables method.

property R_0_noises¶
property R_0_waves¶
property R_L_noises¶
property R_L_waves¶
close(domain, *fields)¶

This function is called once after a stepper ended the computation.

open(domain, *fields)¶

This function is called once before a stepper began the computation. Pass the time, wavelength and center wavelength to all the effects in the equation.

set(waves, noises, z, h)¶

This function is called before each step of the computation.

exception optcom.equations.abstract_ampnlse.AbstractAmpNLSEError¶

Bases: Exception

exception optcom.equations.abstract_ampnlse.UnknownNoiseSplitOptionError¶

optcom.equations.abstract_cnlse module¶

class optcom.equations.abstract_cnlse.AbstractCNLSE(nbr_fibers, beta, kappa, sigma_cross, eta_cross, core_radius, clad_radius, c2c_spacing, n_clad, v_nbr, temperature, ASYM, COUP, XPM, FWM, XNL, NOISE, STEP_UPDATE, INTRA_COMP_DELAY, INTRA_PORT_DELAY, INTER_PORT_DELAY, kerr_effects, raman_effects)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_field_equation.AbstractFieldEquation

Coupled non linear Schrodinger equations.

Represent the different effects in the NLSE as well as the interaction of NLSEs propagating along each others. Note that automatic calculation of the coupling coefficients rely on a formula that is only correct for symmetric coupler.

nbr_eqs¶

Number of NLSEs in the CNLSE.

Type

int

Parameters

  • nbr_fibers -- The number of fibers in the coupler.

  • beta -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\)

  • kappa -- The coupling coefficients. \([km^{-1}]\)

  • sigma_cross -- Positive term multiplying the XPM terms of the NLSE inbetween the fibers.

  • eta_cross -- Positive term multiplying the cross-non-linear terms of the NLSE inbetween the fibers.

  • core_radius -- The core radius. \([\mu m]\)

  • clad_radius -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • c2c_spacing -- The center to center distance between two cores. \([\mu m]\)

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the clading. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • v_nbr -- The V number. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • temperature -- The temperature of the fiber. \([K]\)

  • ASYM -- If True, trigger the asymmetry effects between cores.

  • COUP -- If True, trigger the coupling effects between cores.

  • XPM -- If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation.

  • FWM -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing.

  • XNL -- If True, trigger cross-non linear effects.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update component parameters at each spatial space step by calling the _update_variables method.

  • INTRA_COMP_DELAY -- If True, take into account the relative time difference, between all waves, that is acquired while propagating in the component.

  • INTRA_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields but for each port.

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

  • kerr_effects -- A list with a Kerr effect object for each fiber.

  • raman_effects -- A list with a Raman effect object for each fiber.

op_non_lin(*args, **kwargs)¶
open(domain, *fields)¶

This function is called once before a stepper began the computation. Pass the time, wavelength and center wavelength to all the effects in the equation.

term_non_lin(*args, **kwargs)¶

optcom.equations.abstract_equation module¶

class optcom.equations.abstract_equation.AbstractEquation¶

Bases: object

optcom.equations.abstract_field_equation module¶

class optcom.equations.abstract_field_equation.AbstractFieldEquation(nbr_eqs, prop_dir, SHARE_WAVES, NOISE, STEP_UPDATE, INTRA_COMP_DELAY, INTRA_PORT_DELAY, INTER_PORT_DELAY)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_equation.AbstractEquation

Parent class of any wave equation.

Notes

Considering \(l = 1, \ldots, M\) equations with \(j = 1, \ldots, K_l\) channels per equation, the AbstractFieldEquation class implement the following generic equations:

if (self.SHARE_WAVES):

\[\begin{split}\begin{split} \frac{\partial A_{lj}}{\partial z} &= \sum_{m = 1}^{M} C_{lm}^{lin} E_{lm}^{lin} \Big(\{A_{m1}, \ldots, A_{mK_m}\} \cup \bigcup_{v\neq m}^{M} \{A_{v1}, \ldots, A_{v K_v}\}\Big)\\ &\quad + \sum_{m = 1}^{M} C_{lm}^{nlin} E_{lm}^{nlin} \Big(\{A_{m1}, \ldots, A_{mK_m}\} \cup \bigcup_{v\neq m}^{M} \{A_{v1}, \ldots, A_{v K_v}\}\Big) \\ &\quad + \sum_{m = 1}^{M} C_{lm}^{ind} E_{lm}^{ind} \Big(\{A_{m1}, \ldots, A_{mK_m}\} \cup \bigcup_{v\neq m}^{M} \{A_{v1}, \ldots, A_{v K_v}\}\Big) \\ &\quad + \sum_{s=1}^{S_l} C_{ls}^{f} f_{ls} \Big(\{A_{l1}, \ldots, A_{lK_l}\} \cup \bigcup_{v\neq l}^{M} \{A_{v1}, \ldots, A_{v K_v}\}\Big) \qquad \forall j=1,\ldots,K_l \quad \forall l = 1,\ldots,M \end{split}\end{split}\]

else:

\[\begin{split}\begin{split} \frac{\partial A_{lj}}{\partial z} &= C_{ll}^{lin} E_{ll}^{lin} \Big(\{A_{l1}, \ldots, A_{lK_l}\} \Big) + \sum_{m \neq l}^{M} C_{lm}^{lin} E_{lm}^{lin} \Big(\{A_{m1}, \ldots, A_{mK_m}\} \cup \{A_{lj}\}\Big)\\ &\quad + C_{ll}^{nlin} E_{ll}^{nlin} \Big(\{A_{l1}, \ldots, A_{lK_l}\}\Big) + \sum_{m \neq l}^{M} C_{lm}^{nlin} E_{lm}^{nlin} \Big(\{A_{m1}, \ldots, A_{mK_m}\ \cup \{A_{lj}\}\Big) \\ &\quad + C_{ll}^{ind} E_{ll}^{ind} \Big(\{A_{l1}, \ldots, A_{lK_l}\}\Big) + \sum_{m \neq l}^{M} C_{lm}^{ind} E_{lm}^{ind} \Big(\{A_{m1}, \ldots, A_{mK_m}\} \cup \{A_{lj}\}\Big) \\ &\quad + \sum_{s=1}^{S_l} C_{ls}^{f} f_{ls} (\{A_{l1}, \ldots, A_{lK_l}\}) \qquad \forall j=1,\ldots,K_l \quad \forall l = 1,\ldots,M \end{split}\end{split}\]

where f is a list of length \(M\) where each index \(m\) contains \(S_m\) sub-equations related to equation \(m\), \(E^{lin}\) and \(E^{nlin}\) are matrices of size \(M \times M\) where each index \(ml\) contains resp. linear and non-linear effects of equations \(m\) w.r.t. to equation \(l\).

Parameters

  • nbr_eqs -- The number of equations in the system of equations.

  • prop_dir -- If [i] is True, waves in equation [i] are co-propagating relatively to equation [0]. If [i] is False, waves in equations [i] are counter-propagating relatively to equation [0]. prop_dir[0] must be True. len(prop_dir) must be equal to nbr_eqs.

  • SHARE_WAVES -- If True, pass all waves to each sub-equations. If False, pass only waves, from the fields which were in position i of the initial fields list, to equation i.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update component parameters at each spatial space step by calling the _update_variables method.

  • INTRA_COMP_DELAY -- If True, take into account the relative time difference, between all waves, that is acquired while propagating in the component.

  • INTRA_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields but for each port.

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

calc_noise(noises, z, h)¶

  • h -- The spatial step

Notes

optcom.equations.abstract_nlse module¶

class optcom.equations.abstract_nlse.AbstractNLSE(alpha, alpha_order, beta, beta_order, gamma, core_radius, clad_radius, n_core, n_clad, NA, v_nbr, eff_area, nl_index, medium_core, medium_clad, temperature, ATT, DISP, NOISE, UNI_OMEGA, STEP_UPDATE, INTRA_COMP_DELAY, INTRA_PORT_DELAY, INTER_PORT_DELAY)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_field_equation.AbstractFieldEquation

Non linear Schrodinger equations.

Represent the different effects in the NLSE as well as different types of NLSEs.

Parameters

  • alpha -- The derivatives of the attenuation coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • alpha_order -- The order of alpha coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if alpha values are provided - no file)

  • beta -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • beta_order -- The order of beta coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if beta values are provided - no file)

  • gamma -- The non linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • core_radius -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

  • clad_radius -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • n_core -- The refractive index of the core. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the clading. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • v_nbr -- The V number. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • eff_area -- The effective area. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • nl_index -- The non-linear coefficient. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • medium_core -- The medium of the fiber core.

  • medium_clad -- The medium of the fiber cladding.

  • temperature -- The temperature of the medium. \([K]\)

  • ATT -- If True, trigger the attenuation.

  • DISP -- If True, trigger the dispersion.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update component parameters at each spatial space step by calling the _update_variables method.

  • INTRA_COMP_DELAY -- If True, take into account the relative time difference, between all waves, that is acquired while propagating in the component.

  • INTRA_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields but for each port.

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

property gamma¶
open(domain, *fields)¶

This function is called once before a stepper began the computation. Pass the time, wavelength and center wavelength to all the effects in the equation.

optcom.equations.abstract_re_fiber module¶

class optcom.equations.abstract_re_fiber.AbstractREFiber(N_T, doped_area, n_core, n_clad, NA, v_nbr, eff_area, overlap, sigma_a, sigma_e, core_radius, clad_radius, medium_core, medium_clad, dopant, temperature, RESO_INDEX, CORE_PUMPED, CLAD_PUMPED, NOISE, STEP_UPDATE)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_field_equation.AbstractFieldEquation

Parameters

  • N_T -- The total doping concentration. \([nm^{-3}]\)

  • doped_area -- The doped area. \([\mu m^2]\) If None, will be set to the core area.

  • n_core -- The refractive index of the core. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(n_core)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the cladding. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(n_clad)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(NA)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • v_nbr -- The V number. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(v_nbr)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • eff_area -- The effective area. \([\u m^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(eff_area)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • overlap -- The overlap factors of the signal and the pump. (1<=len(overlap)<=2). [signal, pump] If a callable is provided, the variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma_a -- The absorption cross sections of the signal and the pump (1<=len(sigma_a)<=2). \([nm^2]\) [signal, pump] If a callable is provided, the variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma_e -- The emission cross sections of the signal and the pump (1<=len(sigma_e)<=2). \([nm^2]\) [signal, pump] If a callable is provided, the variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • core_radius -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

  • clad_radius -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • medium_core -- The medium of the core.

  • medium_clad -- The medium of the cladding.

  • dopant -- The doping medium of the active fiber.

  • temperature -- The temperature of the fiber. \([K]\)

  • RESO_INDEX -- If True, trigger the resonant refractive index which will be added to the core refractive index. To see the effect of the resonant index, the flag STEP_UPDATE must be set to True in order to update the dispersion coefficient at each space step depending on the resonant index at each space step.

  • CORE_PUMPED -- If True, there is dopant in the core.

  • CLAD_PUMPED -- If True, there is dopant in the cladding.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update fiber parameters at each spatial sub-step.

optcom.equations.ampanlse module¶

class optcom.equations.ampanlse.AmpANLSE(re_fiber, alpha=[None], alpha_order=0, beta=[None], beta_order=2, gain_order=0, gamma=[None], sigma=2.0, eta=2.0, T_R=0.003, n_core=[None], n_clad=[None], NA=[None], v_nbr=[None], eff_area=[None], nl_index=[None], overlap=[None], sigma_a=[None], sigma_e=[None], en_sat=[None], R_0=0.0008, R_L=0.0008, core_radius=5.0, clad_radius=12.5, medium_core='sio2', medium_clad='sio2', temperature=293.1, ATT=[True, True], DISP=[True, False], SPM=[True, False], XPM=[False, False], FWM=[False, False], SS=[False, False], RS=[False, False], XNL=[False, False], GAIN_SAT=False, NOISE=True, approx_type=1, split_noise_option='seed_split', UNI_OMEGA=[True, True], STEP_UPDATE=True, INTRA_COMP_DELAY=True, INTRA_PORT_DELAY=True, INTER_PORT_DELAY=False)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_ampnlse.AbstractAmpNLSE

Approximated non linear Schrodinger equations for fiber amplifier.

Represent the different effects in the approximated NLSE for fiber amplifier.

Parameters

  • re_fiber (AbstractREFiber) -- The rate equations describing the fiber laser dynamics.

  • alpha -- The derivatives of the attenuation coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • alpha_order -- The order of alpha coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if alpha values are provided - no file)

  • beta -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • beta_order -- The order of beta coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if beta values are provided - no file)

  • gain_order -- The order of the gain coefficients to take into account.

  • gamma -- The non linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma -- Positive term multiplying the XPM terms of the NLSE.

  • eta -- Positive term multiplying the cross-non-linear terms of the NLSE.

  • T_R -- The raman coefficient. \([]\)

  • n_core -- The refractive index of the core. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(n_core)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the cladding. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(n_clad)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(NA)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • v_nbr -- The V number. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(v_nbr)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • eff_area -- The effective area. \([\u m^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(eff_area)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • nl_index -- The non-linear coefficient. \([m^2\cdot W^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(nl_index)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • overlap -- The overlap factor. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(overlap)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • sigma_a -- The absorption cross sections. \([nm^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(sigma_a)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • sigma_e -- The emission cross sections. \([nm^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(sigma_e)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • en_sat -- The saturation energy. \([J]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(en_sat)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • R_0 -- The reflectivity at the fiber start. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • R_L -- The reflectivity at the fiber end. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • core_radius -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

  • clad_radius -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • medium_core -- The medium of the core.

  • medium_clad -- The medium of the cladding.

  • temperature -- The temperature of the medium. \([K]\)

  • ATT -- If True, trigger the attenuation. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • DISP -- If True, trigger the dispersion. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • SPM -- If True, trigger the self-phase modulation. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • XPM -- If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • FWM -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • SS -- If True, trigger the self-steepening. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • RS -- If True, trigger the Raman scattering. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • XNL -- If True, trigger cross-non linear effects. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • GAIN_SAT -- If True, trigger the gain saturation.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • approx_type -- The type of the NLSE approximation.

  • split_noise_option -- The way the spontaneous emission power is split among the fields.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update fiber parameters at each spatial sub-step.

  • INTRA_COMP_DELAY -- If True, take into account the relative time difference, between all waves, that is acquired while propagating in the component.

  • INTRA_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields but for each port.

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

optcom.equations.ampgnlse module¶

class optcom.equations.ampgnlse.AmpGNLSE(re_fiber, alpha=[None], alpha_order=0, beta=[None], beta_order=2, gain_order=0, gamma=[None], sigma=2.0, eta=2.0, h_R=None, f_R=0.245, n_core=[None], n_clad=[None], NA=[None], v_nbr=[None], eff_area=[None], nl_index=[None], overlap=[None], sigma_a=[None], sigma_e=[None], en_sat=[None], R_0=0.0008, R_L=0.0008, core_radius=5.0, clad_radius=12.5, medium_core='sio2', medium_clad='sio2', temperature=293.1, ATT=[True, True], DISP=[True, False], SPM=[True, False], XPM=[False, False], FWM=[False, False], XNL=[False, False], GAIN_SAT=False, NOISE=True, split_noise_option='seed_split', UNI_OMEGA=[True, True], STEP_UPDATE=False, INTRA_COMP_DELAY=True, INTRA_PORT_DELAY=True, INTER_PORT_DELAY=False)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_ampnlse.AbstractAmpNLSE

General non linear Schrodinger equations for fiber amplifier.

Represent the different effects in the GNLSE for fiber amplifier.

Parameters

  • re_fiber (AbstractREFiber) -- The rate equations describing the fiber laser dynamics.

  • alpha -- The derivatives of the attenuation coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • alpha_order -- The order of alpha coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if alpha values are provided - no file)

  • beta -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • beta_order -- The order of beta coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if beta values are provided - no file)

  • gain_order -- The order of the gain coefficients to take into account.

  • gamma -- The non linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma -- Positive term multiplying the XPM terms of the NLSE.

  • eta -- Positive term multiplying the cross-non-linear terms of the NLSE.

  • h_R -- The Raman response function values. If a callable is provided, variable must be time. \([ps]\)

  • f_R -- The fractional contribution of the delayed Raman response. \([]\)

  • n_core -- The refractive index of the core. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(n_core)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the cladding. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(n_clad)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(NA)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • v_nbr -- The V number. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(v_nbr)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • eff_area -- The effective area. \([\u m^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(eff_area)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • nl_index -- The non-linear coefficient. \([m^2\cdot W^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(nl_index)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • overlap -- The overlap factor. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(overlap)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • sigma_a -- The absorption cross sections. \([nm^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(sigma_a)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • sigma_e -- The emission cross sections. \([nm^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(sigma_e)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • en_sat -- The saturation energy. \([J]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(en_sat)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • R_0 -- The reflectivity at the fiber start. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • R_L -- The reflectivity at the fiber end. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • core_radius -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

  • clad_radius -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • medium_core -- The medium of the core.

  • medium_clad -- The medium of the cladding.

  • temperature -- The temperature of the medium. \([K]\)

  • ATT -- If True, trigger the attenuation. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • DISP -- If True, trigger the dispersion. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • SPM -- If True, trigger the self-phase modulation. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • XPM -- If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • FWM -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • XNL -- If True, trigger cross-non linear effects. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • GAIN_SAT -- If True, trigger the gain saturation.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • split_noise_option -- The way the spontaneous emission power is split among the fields.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update fiber parameters at each spatial sub-step.

  • INTRA_COMP_DELAY -- If True, take into account the relative time difference, between all waves, that is acquired while propagating in the component.

  • INTRA_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields but for each port.

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

term_rk4ip_non_lin(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_ampnlse.AbstractAmpNLSE

Hybrid Non linear Schrodinger equations for fiber amplifier.

Represent the different effects in the NLSE or the GNLSE for fiber amplifier. Each of the pump and seed pulse can be allocated to NLSE or GNLSE.

Parameters

  • re_fiber (AbstractREFiber) -- The rate equations describing the fiber laser dynamics.

  • alpha -- The derivatives of the attenuation coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • alpha_order -- The order of alpha coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if alpha values are provided - no file)

  • beta -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • beta_order -- The order of beta coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if beta values are provided - no file)

  • gain_order -- The order of the gain coefficients to take into account.

  • gamma -- The non linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma -- Positive term multiplying the XPM terms of the NLSE.

  • eta -- Positive term multiplying the cross-non-linear terms of the NLSE.

  • h_R -- The Raman response function values. If a callable is provided, variable must be time. \([ps]\)

  • f_R -- The fractional contribution of the delayed Raman response. \([]\)

  • n_core -- The refractive index of the core. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(n_core)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the cladding. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(n_clad)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(NA)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • v_nbr -- The V number. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(v_nbr)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • eff_area -- The effective area. \([\u m^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(eff_area)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • nl_index -- The non-linear coefficient. \([m^2\cdot W^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(nl_index)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • overlap -- The overlap factor. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(overlap)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • sigma_a -- The absorption cross sections. \([nm^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(sigma_a)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • sigma_e -- The emission cross sections. \([nm^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(sigma_e)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • en_sat -- The saturation energy. \([J]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(en_sat)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • R_0 -- The reflectivity at the fiber start. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • R_L -- The reflectivity at the fiber end. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • core_radius -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

  • clad_radius -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • medium_core -- The medium of the core.

  • medium_clad -- The medium of the cladding.

  • temperature -- The temperature of the medium. \([K]\)

  • ATT -- If True, trigger the attenuation. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • DISP -- If True, trigger the dispersion. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • SPM -- If True, trigger the self-phase modulation. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • XPM -- If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • FWM -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • SS -- If True, trigger the self-steepening. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • XNL -- If True, trigger cross-non linear effects. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • GAIN_SAT -- If True, trigger the gain saturation.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • split_noise_option -- The way the spontaneous emission power is split among the fields.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update fiber parameters at each spatial sub-step.

  • INTRA_COMP_DELAY -- If True, take into account the relative time difference, between all waves, that is acquired while propagating in the component.

  • INTRA_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields but for each port.

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

optcom.equations.anlse module¶

class optcom.equations.anlse.ANLSE(alpha=None, alpha_order=0, beta=None, beta_order=2, gamma=None, sigma=2.0, eta=2.0, T_R=0.003, core_radius=5.0, clad_radius=12.5, n_core=None, n_clad=None, NA=None, v_nbr=None, eff_area=None, nl_index=None, medium_core='sio2', medium_clad='sio2', temperature=293.1, ATT=True, DISP=True, SPM=True, XPM=False, FWM=False, SS=False, RS=False, XNL=False, NOISE=True, approx_type=1, UNI_OMEGA=True, STEP_UPDATE=False, INTRA_COMP_DELAY=True, INTRA_PORT_DELAY=True, INTER_PORT_DELAY=False)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_nlse.AbstractNLSE

Approximated non linear Schrodinger equations.

Represent the different effects in the approximated NLSE.

Notes

Equations :

NLSE approximation 1:

\[\frac{\partial A_j}{\partial t} = i\gamma \Bigg[ |A_j|^2 + \sigma \sum_{k\neq j}|A_k|^2 + i S \frac{1}{A_j} \bigg(\frac{\partial |A_j|^2 A_j}{\partial t} + \eta \sum_{k\neq j} \frac{\partial |A_k|^2 A_j}{\partial t} \bigg) - T_R \bigg(\frac{\partial |A_j|^2}{\partial t} + \eta \sum_{k\neq j} \frac{\partial |A_k|^2}{\partial t} \bigg) \Bigg] A_j\]

NLSE approximation 2:

\[\frac{\partial A_j}{\partial t} = i\gamma \Bigg[ |A_j|^2 + \sigma \sum_{k\neq j}|A_k|^2 + i S \bigg(A^{*}_j + \frac{\eta}{A_j} \sum_{k\neq j}|A_k|^2\bigg) \frac{\partial A_j}{\partial t} + \big(i S - T_R\big) \frac{\partial |A_j|^2}{\partial t} + \eta \big(i S - T_R\big) \sum_{k\neq j} \frac{\partial |A_k|^2}{\partial t} \Bigg] A_j\]

NLSE approximation 3:

\[\frac{\partial A_j}{\partial t} = i\gamma \Bigg[ |A_j|^2 + \sigma \sum_{k\neq j}|A_k|^2 + \bigg((2 i S - T_R) A^{*}_j + i S \frac{\eta}{A_j} \sum_{k\neq j} |A_k|^2\bigg) \frac{\partial A_j}{\partial t} + \big(i S - T_R\big) A_j \frac{\partial A^{*}_j}{\partial t} + \eta \big(i S - T_R\big) \sum_{k\neq j} \frac{\partial |A_k|^2}{\partial t} \Bigg] A_j\]

Implementation:

NLSE approximation 1:

\[\begin{split}\begin{split} \hat{N}(A_j) = i\gamma \Bigg[ |A_j|^2 + \sigma \sum_{k\neq j}|A_k|^2 + i S \frac{1}{A_j} \mathcal{F}^{-1}\bigg\{ (-i \omega) \mathcal{F}\Big\{|A_j|^2 A_j + \eta \sum_{k\neq j}|A_k|^2 A_j\Big\}\bigg\} \\ \quad\quad\quad - T_R \mathcal{F}^{-1}\bigg\{(-i\omega) \mathcal{F}\Big\{|A_j|^2+ \eta \sum_{k\neq j}|A_k|^2 \Big\}\bigg\} \Bigg] \end{split}\end{split}\]

NLSE approximation 2:

\[\begin{split}\begin{split} \hat{N}(A_j) = i\gamma \Bigg[ |A_j|^2 + \sigma\sum_{k\neq j}|A_k|^2 + i S \Big(A_j^* + \eta \sum_{k\neq j}|A_k|^2\Big) \mathcal{F}^{-1}\big\{ (-i \omega) \mathcal{F}\{A_j\}\big\}\\ \quad\quad\quad + \big(i S - T_R\big)\mathcal{F}^{-1}\bigg\{(-i\omega) \mathcal{F}\Big\{|A_j|^2 + \eta \sum_{k\neq j}|A_k|^2\Big\}\bigg\} \Bigg] \end{split}\end{split}\]

NLSE approximation 3:

\[\begin{split}\begin{split} \hat{N}(A_j) = i\gamma \Bigg[ |A_j|^2 + \sigma\sum_{k\neq j}|A_k|^2 + \bigg((2 i S - T_R) A_j^* + i\eta S \sum_{k\neq j}|A_k|^2\bigg) \mathcal{F}^{-1}\big\{ (- i \omega) \mathcal{F}\{A_j\}\big\} \\ \quad\quad\quad + \big(i S - T_R\big) A_j \mathcal{F}^{-1}\big\{(-i\omega)\mathcal{F}\{A_j^*\}\big\} + \eta\big(i S - T_R\big) \mathcal{F}^{-1}\bigg\{ (- i \omega) \mathcal{F}\Big\{\sum_{k\neq j}|A_k|^2\Big\}\bigg\}\Bigg] \end{split}\end{split}\]
Parameters

  • alpha -- The derivatives of the attenuation coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • alpha_order -- The order of alpha coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if alpha values are provided - no file)

  • beta -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • beta_order -- The order of beta coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if beta values are provided - no file)

  • gamma -- The non linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma -- Positive term multiplying the XPM terms of the NLSE.

  • eta -- Positive term multiplying the cross-non-linear terms of the NLSE.

  • T_R -- The raman coefficient. \([]\)

  • core_radius -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

  • clad_radius -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • n_core -- The refractive index of the core. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the clading. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • v_nbr -- The V number. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • eff_area -- The effective area. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • nl_index -- The non-linear coefficient. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • medium_core -- The medium of the fiber core.

  • medium_clad -- The medium of the fiber cladding.

  • temperature -- The temperature of the fiber. \([K]\)

  • ATT -- If True, trigger the attenuation.

  • DISP -- If True, trigger the dispersion.

  • SPM -- If True, trigger the self-phase modulation.

  • XPM -- If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation.

  • FWM -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing.

  • SS -- If True, trigger the self-steepening.

  • RS -- If True, trigger the Raman scattering.

  • XNL -- If True, trigger cross-non linear effects.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • approx_type -- The type of the NLSE approximation.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update fiber parameters at each spatial sub-step.

  • INTRA_COMP_DELAY -- If True, take into account the relative time difference, between all waves, that is acquired while propagating in the component.

  • INTRA_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields but for each port.

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

op_non_lin(waves, id, corr_wave=None)¶

Represent the non linear effects of the approximated NLSE.

open(domain, *fields)¶

This function is called once before a stepper began the computation. Pass the time, wavelength and center wavelength to all the effects in the equation.

term_non_lin(waves, id, z, corr_wave=None)¶

Represent the non linear effects of the approximated NLSE.

optcom.equations.ase_noise module¶

class optcom.equations.ase_noise.ASENoise(se_power, gain_coeff, absorp_coeff, noise_omega)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_equation.AbstractEquation

Calculate the noise propagation in fiber amplifier.

Notes

\[\begin{split} \frac{\partial P_{ase}^{\pm}(z)}{\partial z} = &\pm \Big[\Gamma_{s}(\omega)\big[\sigma_{e}(\omega) N_i(z) - \sigma_{a}(\omega)N_j(z)\big] - \eta(\omega)\Big] P_{ase}^\pm (z) & \pm \Gamma_{s}(\omega)\sigma_{e}(\omega) N_i(z) P_{0}^\pm(z) \end{split}\]
Parameters

  • se_power -- The spontaneous emission power. \([W]\)

  • gain_coeff (optcom.parameters.fiber.doped_fiber_gain.DopedFiberGain) -- The gain coefficient of the noise.

  • absorp_coeff (optcom.parameters.fiber.doped_fiber_gain.DopedFiberGain) -- The absorption coefficient of the noise.

  • noise_omega -- The angular frequencies composing the noise array. \([ps^{-1}]\)

optcom.equations.canlse module¶

class optcom.equations.canlse.CANLSE(nbr_fibers=2, alpha=[None], alpha_order=0, beta=[None], beta_order=2, gamma=[None], kappa=[[None]], sigma=[2.0], sigma_cross=[[0.0]], eta=[2.0], eta_cross=[[0.0]], T_R=[0.003], core_radius=[5.0], clad_radius=62.5, c2c_spacing=[[15.0]], n_core=[None], n_clad=None, NA=[None], v_nbr=[None], eff_area=[None], nl_index=[None], medium_core=['sio2'], medium_clad='sio2', temperature=293.1, ATT=True, DISP=True, SPM=True, XPM=False, FWM=False, SS=False, RS=False, XNL=False, ASYM=True, COUP=True, NOISE=True, approx_type=1, UNI_OMEGA=True, STEP_UPDATE=True, INTRA_COMP_DELAY=True, INTRA_PORT_DELAY=True, INTER_PORT_DELAY=False)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_cnlse.AbstractCNLSE

Coupled non linear Schrodinger equations.

Represent the different effects in the NLSE as well as the interaction of NLSEs propagating along each others. Note that automatic calculation of the coupling coefficients rely on a formula that is only correct for symmetric coupler.

nbr_eqs¶

Number of NLSEs in the CNLSE.

Type

int

Parameters

  • nbr_fibers -- The number of fibers in the coupler.

  • alpha -- The derivatives of the attenuation coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • alpha_order -- The order of alpha coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if alpha values are provided - no file)

  • beta -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • beta_order -- The order of beta coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if beta values are provided - no file)

  • gamma -- The non linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • kappa -- The coupling coefficients. \([km^{-1}]\)

  • sigma -- Positive term multiplying the XPM terms of the NLSE.

  • sigma_cross -- Positive term multiplying the XPM terms of the NLSE inbetween the fibers.

  • eta -- Positive term multiplying the cross-non-linear terms of the NLSE.

  • eta_cross -- Positive term multiplying the cross-non-linear terms of the NLSE inbetween the fibers.

  • T_R -- The raman coefficient. \([]\)

  • core_radius -- The core radius. \([\mu m]\)

  • clad_radius -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • c2c_spacing -- The center to center distance between two cores. \([\mu m]\)

  • n_core -- The refractive index of the core. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the clading. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • v_nbr -- The V number. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • eff_area -- The effective area. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • nl_index -- The non-linear coefficient. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • medium_core -- The medium of the fiber core.

  • medium_clad -- The medium of the fiber cladding.

  • temperature -- The temperature of the fiber. \([K]\)

  • ATT -- If True, trigger the attenuation.

  • DISP -- If True, trigger the dispersion.

  • SPM -- If True, trigger the self-phase modulation.

  • XPM -- If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation.

  • FWM -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing.

  • SS (bool) -- If True, trigger the self-steepening.

  • RS -- If True, trigger the Raman scattering.

  • XNL -- If True, trigger cross-non linear effects.

  • ASYM -- If True, trigger the asymmetry effects between cores.

  • COUP -- If True, trigger the coupling effects between cores.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • approx_type -- The type of the NLSE approximation.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update fiber parameters at each spatial sub-step.

  • INTRA_COMP_DELAY -- If True, take into account the relative time difference, between all waves, that is acquired while propagating in the component.

  • INTRA_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields but for each port.

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

optcom.equations.cgnlse module¶

class optcom.equations.cgnlse.CGNLSE(nbr_fibers=2, alpha=[None], alpha_order=0, beta=[None], beta_order=2, gamma=[None], kappa=[[None]], sigma=[2.0], sigma_cross=[[0.0]], eta=[2.0], eta_cross=[[0.0]], h_R=[None], f_R=0.245, core_radius=[5.0], clad_radius=62.5, c2c_spacing=[[15.0]], n_core=[None], n_clad=None, NA=[None], v_nbr=[None], eff_area=[None], nl_index=[None], medium_core=['sio2'], medium_clad='sio2', temperature=293.1, ATT=True, DISP=True, SPM=True, XPM=False, FWM=False, XNL=False, ASYM=True, COUP=True, NOISE=True, UNI_OMEGA=True, STEP_UPDATE=True, INTRA_COMP_DELAY=True, INTRA_PORT_DELAY=True, INTER_PORT_DELAY=False)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_cnlse.AbstractCNLSE

Coupled non linear Schrodinger equations.

Represent the different effects in the NLSE as well as the interaction of NLSEs propagating along each others. Note that automatic calculation of the coupling coefficients rely on a formula that is only correct for symmetric coupler.

nbr_eqs¶

Number of NLSEs in the CNLSE.

Type

int

Parameters

  • nbr_fibers -- The number of fibers in the coupler.

  • alpha -- The derivatives of the attenuation coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • alpha_order -- The order of alpha coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if alpha values are provided - no file)

  • beta -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • beta_order -- The order of beta coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if beta values are provided - no file)

  • gamma -- The non linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • kappa -- The coupling coefficients. \([km^{-1}]\)

  • sigma -- Positive term multiplying the XPM terms of the NLSE.

  • sigma_cross -- Positive term multiplying the XPM terms of the NLSE inbetween the fibers.

  • eta -- Positive term multiplying the cross-non-linear terms of the NLSE.

  • eta_cross -- Positive term multiplying the cross-non-linear terms of the NLSE inbetween the fibers.

  • h_R -- The Raman response function values. If a callable is provided, variable must be time. \([ps]\)

  • f_R -- The fractional contribution of the delayed Raman response. \([]\)

  • core_radius -- The core radius. \([\mu m]\)

  • clad_radius -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • c2c_spacing -- The center to center distance between two cores. \([\mu m]\)

  • n_core -- The refractive index of the core. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the clading. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • v_nbr -- The V number. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • eff_area -- The effective area. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • nl_index -- The non-linear coefficient. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • medium_core -- The medium of the fiber core.

  • medium_clad -- The medium of the fiber cladding.

  • temperature -- The temperature of the fiber. \([K]\)

  • ATT -- If True, trigger the attenuation.

  • DISP -- If True, trigger the dispersion.

  • SPM -- If True, trigger the self-phase modulation.

  • XPM -- If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation.

  • FWM -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing.

  • SS (bool) -- If True, trigger the self-steepening.

  • RS -- If True, trigger the Raman scattering.

  • XNL -- If True, trigger cross-non linear effects.

  • ASYM -- If True, trigger the asymmetry effects between cores.

  • COUP -- If True, trigger the coupling effects between cores.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update fiber parameters at each spatial sub-step.

  • INTRA_COMP_DELAY -- If True, take into account the relative time difference, between all waves, that is acquired while propagating in the component.

  • INTRA_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields but for each port.

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

Represent the different effects in the NLSE as well as the interaction of NLSEs propagating along each others. Note that automatic calculation of the coupling coefficients rely on a formula that is only correct for symmetric coupler.

  • FWM -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing.

  • RS -- If True, trigger the Raman scattering.

  • COUP -- If True, trigger the coupling effects between cores.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • INTRA_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields but for each port.

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

optcom.equations.coupler_noise module¶

class optcom.equations.coupler_noise.CouplerNoise(coupling_coeff, asymmetry_coeff, noise_omega)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_equation.AbstractEquation

Calculate the noise propagation in fiber coupler.

Notes

\[\begin{split}\begin{split} \frac{\partial P_{ljw}}{\partial z} = & -\alpha_{lw} P_{ljw} + 2i \sum_{\substack{m=1 \\ m\neq l}}^{M} \sum_{k=1}^{K_m} \sum_{n=1}^{W_k} \kappa_{lmn} P_{mkn} + 2i \sum_{\substack{m=1 \\ m\neq l}}^{M} \delta_{almw} P_{ljw} \\ & \text{for } \begin{cases} l = 1,\ldots,M \text{ with } M \text{ the number of cores}\\ j = 1,\ldots,K_l \text{ with } K_l \text{ the number of noise channels in core } l\\ w = 1,\ldots,W_j \text{ with } W_j \text{ the number of wavelength constituents } \text{of noise channel j} \end{cases} \end{split}\end{split}\]

optcom.equations.fresnel module¶

class optcom.equations.fresnel.Fresnel¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_equation.AbstractEquation

Fresnel equations.

Represent the Fresnel equations which describe the reflection and transmission of light at the interface of two media.

static irradiance_p_pol(n_1, n_2, theta_i, theta_t=None)¶

Calcul the p-polarization irradiance.

Parameters

  • n_1 -- The refractive index of the medium of the incident light.

  • n_2 -- The refractive index of the medium of the transmitted light.

  • theta_i -- The angle of incidence.

  • theta_t -- The angle of transmission.

Returns

The p-polarization irradiance.

Notes

\[T_p = 1 - R_p\]
static irradiance_s_pol(n_1, n_2, theta_i, theta_t=None)¶

Calcul the s-polarization irradiance.

Parameters

  • n_1 -- The refractive index of the medium of the incident light.

  • n_2 -- The refractive index of the medium of the transmitted light.

  • theta_i -- The angle of incidence.

  • theta_t -- The angle of transmission.

Returns

The s-polarization irradiance.

Notes

\[T_s = 1 - R_s\]
static reflectance_p_pol(n_1, n_2, theta_i, theta_t=None)¶

Calcul the s-polarization reflectance.

Parameters

  • n_1 -- The refractive index of the medium of the incident light.

  • n_2 -- The refractive index of the medium of the transmitted light.

  • theta_i -- The angle of incidence.

  • theta_t -- The angle of transmission.

Returns

The p-polarization reflectance.

Notes

\[R_p = \bigg\lvert \frac{n_1 \cos(\theta_t) - n_2\cos(\theta_i)}{n_1 \cos(\theta_t) + n_2\cos(\theta_i)} \bigg\rvert^2 = \Bigg\lvert\frac{n_1\sqrt{1-\big(\frac{n_1}{n_2} \sin(\theta_i)\big)^2} - n_2\cos(\theta_i)}{n_1\sqrt{1-\big(\frac{n_1}{n_2} \sin(\theta_i)\big)^2} + n_2\cos(\theta_i) } \Bigg\rvert^2\]
static reflectance_s_pol(n_1, n_2, theta_i, theta_t=None)¶

Calcul the s-polarization reflectance.

Parameters

  • n_1 -- The refractive index of the medium of the incident light.

  • n_2 -- The refractive index of the medium of the transmitted light.

  • theta_i -- The angle of incidence.

  • theta_t -- The angle of transmission.

Returns

The s-polarization reflectance.

Notes

\[R_s = \bigg\lvert \frac{n_1 \cos(\theta_i) - n_2\cos(\theta_t)}{n_1 \cos(\theta_i) + n_2\cos(\theta_t)} \bigg\rvert^2 = \Bigg\lvert \frac{n_1\cos(\theta_i) -n_2\sqrt{1-\big(\frac{n_1}{n_2} \sin(\theta_i)\big)^2}}{n_1\cos(\theta_i) + n_2 \sqrt{1-\big(\frac{n_1}{n_2} \sin(\theta_i)\big)^2}} \Bigg\rvert^2\]

optcom.equations.gnlse module¶

class optcom.equations.gnlse.GNLSE(alpha=None, alpha_order=0, beta=None, beta_order=2, gamma=None, sigma=2.0, eta=2.0, h_R=None, f_R=0.245, core_radius=5.0, clad_radius=12.5, n_core=None, n_clad=None, NA=None, v_nbr=None, eff_area=None, nl_index=None, medium_core='sio2', medium_clad='sio2', temperature=293.1, ATT=True, DISP=True, SPM=True, XPM=False, FWM=False, XNL=False, NOISE=True, UNI_OMEGA=True, STEP_UPDATE=False, INTRA_COMP_DELAY=True, INTRA_PORT_DELAY=True, INTER_PORT_DELAY=False)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_nlse.AbstractNLSE

General non linear Schrodinger equations.

Represent the different effects in the GNLSE.

Notes

\[\begin{split}\begin{split} \frac{\partial A_j}{\partial t} &= i\gamma \Big(1+\frac{i}{\omega_0} \frac{\partial}{\partial t}\Big) \Bigg[\bigg[(1-f_R)|A_j(z,t)|^2 + f_R\int_{-\infty}^{+\infty}h_R(s)|A_j(z,t-s)|^2 ds \bigg] \\ &\quad + \sum_{k\neq j} \bigg[\sigma (1-f_R)|A_k(z,t)|^2 + \eta f_R\int_{-\infty}^{+\infty}h_R(s)|A_k(z,t-s)|^2 ds\bigg] \Bigg] A_j \end{split}\end{split}\]
Parameters

  • alpha -- The derivatives of the attenuation coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • alpha_order -- The order of alpha coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if alpha values are provided - no file)

  • beta -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • beta_order -- The order of beta coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if beta values are provided - no file)

  • gamma -- The non linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma -- Positive term multiplying the XPM terms of the NLSE.

  • eta -- Positive term multiplying the cross-non-linear terms of the NLSE.

  • h_R -- The Raman response function values. If a callable is provided, variable must be time. \([ps]\)

  • f_R -- The fractional contribution of the delayed Raman response. \([]\)

  • core_radius -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

  • clad_radius -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • n_core -- The refractive index of the core. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the clading. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • v_nbr -- The V number. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • eff_area -- The effective area. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • nl_index -- The non-linear coefficient. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • medium_core -- The medium of the fiber core.

  • medium_clad -- The medium of the fiber cladding.

  • temperature -- The temperature of the fiber. \([K]\)

  • ATT -- If True, trigger the attenuation.

  • DISP -- If True, trigger the dispersion.

  • SPM -- If True, trigger the self-phase modulation.

  • XPM -- If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation.

  • FWM -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing.

  • XNL -- If True, trigger cross-non linear effects.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update fiber parameters at each spatial sub-step.

  • INTRA_COMP_DELAY -- If True, take into account the relative time difference, between all waves, that is acquired while propagating in the component.

  • INTRA_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields but for each port.

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

This function is called once before a stepper began the computation. Pass the time, wavelength and center wavelength to all the effects in the equation.

optcom.equations.mccumber module¶

class optcom.equations.mccumber.McCumber(dopant='yb', medium='yb', stark_energies=[], [])¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_equation.AbstractEquation

McCumber relations.

Represent McCumber relations which give a relationship between the effective cross-sections of absorption and emission of light in the solid-state laser physics. 2

Notes

\[\frac{\sigma_e(\omega)}{\sigma_a(\omega)} = \frac{Z_L}{Z_U} \exp\Big[\frac{E_{UL}-\hbar\omega} {k_{B}T}\Big]\]

where

\[\begin{split}\begin{split} Z_L = \sum_i \exp\Big[-\frac{\Delta E_{Li}}{k_B T}\Big]\\ Z_U = \sum_j \exp\Big[-\frac{\Delta E_{Uj}}{k_B T}\Big] \end{split}\end{split}\]

References

2

Florea, C. and Winick, K.A., 1999. Ytterbium-doped glass waveguide laser fabricated by ion exchange. Journal of Lightwave Technology, 17(9), pp.1593-1601.

Parameters

  • dopant -- The doping medium.

  • medium -- The fiber medium.

  • stark_energies -- The stark energies of the first level and the second level. The first element of the tuple is a list with all stark energies of the first level and the second element of the tuple is a list with all stark energies of the second level. \([cm^{-1}]\) (dopant and medium will be ignored if stark_energies are provided)

static calc_cross_section_absorption(omega, sigma_e, T, stark_energies)¶

Calcul the absorption cross section.

Parameters

  • omega -- The angular frequency. \([rad\cdot ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma_e -- The emission cross section. \([nm^2]\)

  • T -- The temperature. \([K]\)

  • stark_energies -- The stark energies of the first level and the second level. The first element of the tuple is a list with all stark energies of the first level and the second element of the tuple is a list with all stark energies of the second level. \([cm^{-1}]\)

Returns

Value of the absorption cross section. \([nm^2]\)

Notes

\[\sigma_a(\omega) = \sigma_e(\omega) \frac{Z_U}{Z_L} \exp\Big[\frac{\hbar\omega - E_{UL}} {k_{B}T}\Big]\]
static calc_cross_section_emission(omega, sigma_a, T, stark_energies)¶

Calcul the emission cross section.

Parameters

  • omega -- The angular frequency. \([rad\cdot ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma_a -- The absorption cross section. \([nm^2]\)

  • T -- The temperature. \([K]\)

  • stark_energies -- The stark energies of the first level and the second level. The first element of the tuple is a list with all stark energies of the first level and the second element of the tuple is a list with all stark energies of the second level. \([cm^{-1}]\)

Returns

Value of the absorption cross section. \([nm^2]\)

Notes

\[\sigma_e(\omega) = \sigma_a(\omega) \frac{Z_L}{Z_U} \exp\Big[\frac{E_{UL}-\hbar\omega} {k_{B}T}\Big]\]

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

term_non_lin(waves, id, z, corr_wave=None)¶

optcom.equations.re_fiber_2levels module¶

class optcom.equations.re_fiber_2levels.REFiber2Levels(N_T=0.063, tau=840.0, doped_area=None, n_core=[None], n_clad=[None], NA=[None], v_nbr=[None], eff_area=[None], overlap=[None], sigma_a=[None], sigma_e=[None], core_radius=5.0, clad_radius=12.5, medium_core='sio2', medium_clad='sio2', dopant='yb', temperature=293.1, RESO_INDEX=True, CORE_PUMPED=True, CLAD_PUMPED=False, NOISE=True, UNI_OMEGA=[True, True], STEP_UPDATE=False)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_re_fiber.AbstractREFiber

Parameters

  • N_T -- The total doping concentration. \([nm^{-3}]\)

  • tau -- The lifetime of the metastable level. \([\mu s]\)

  • doped_area -- The doped area. \([\mu m^2]\) If None, will be set to the core area.

  • n_core -- The refractive index of the core. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(n_core)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the cladding. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(n_clad)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(NA)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • v_nbr -- The V number. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(v_nbr)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • eff_area -- The effective area. \([\u m^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(eff_area)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • overlap -- The overlap factors of the signal and the pump. (1<=len(overlap)<=2). [signal, pump] If a callable is provided, the variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma_a -- The absorption cross sections of the signal and the pump (1<=len(sigma_a)<=2). \([nm^2]\) [signal, pump] If a callable is provided, the variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma_e -- The emission cross sections of the signal and the pump (1<=len(sigma_e)<=2). \([nm^2]\) [signal, pump] If a callable is provided, the variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • core_radius -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

  • clad_radius -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • medium_core -- The medium of the core.

  • medium_clad -- The medium of the cladding.

  • dopant -- The doping medium of the active fiber.

  • temperature -- The temperature of the fiber. \([K]\)

  • RESO_INDEX -- If True, trigger the resonant refractive index which will be added to the core refractive index. To see the effect of the resonant index, the flag STEP_UPDATE must be set to True in order to update the dispersion coefficient at each space step depending on the resonant index at each space step.

  • CORE_PUMPED -- If True, there is dopant in the core.

  • CLAD_PUMPED -- If True, there is dopant in the cladding.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update fiber parameters at each spatial sub-step.

pre_pass()¶

This function is called before a pass through the component, i.e. before the call to the step method in the stepper.

set(waves, noises, z, h)¶

This function is called before each step of the computation.

class optcom.equations.re_fiber_yb.REFiberYb(N_T=0.063, tau=840.0, doped_area=None, n_core=[None], n_clad=[None], NA=[None], v_nbr=[None], eff_area=[None], overlap=[None], sigma_a=[None], sigma_e=[None], core_radius=5.0, clad_radius=12.5, medium_core='sio2', medium_clad='sio2', temperature=293.1, RESO_INDEX=True, CORE_PUMPED=True, CLAD_PUMPED=False, NOISE=True, UNI_OMEGA=[True, True], STEP_UPDATE=False)¶

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the cladding. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(n_clad)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(NA)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • v_nbr -- The V number. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(v_nbr)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • eff_area -- The effective area. \([\u m^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(eff_area)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • overlap -- The overlap factors of the signal and the pump. (1<=len(overlap)<=2). [signal, pump] If a callable is provided, the variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma_a -- The absorption cross sections of the signal and the pump (1<=len(sigma_a)<=2). \([nm^2]\) [signal, pump] If a callable is provided, the variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma_e -- The emission cross sections of the signal and the pump (1<=len(sigma_e)<=2). \([nm^2]\) [signal, pump] If a callable is provided, the variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • clad_radius -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • medium_core -- The medium of the core.

  • medium_clad -- The medium of the cladding.

  • temperature -- The temperature of the fiber. \([K]\)

  • RESO_INDEX -- If True, trigger the resonant refractive index which will be added to the core refractive index. To see the effect of the resonant index, the flag STEP_UPDATE must be set to True in order to update the dispersion coefficient at each space step depending on the resonant index at each space step.

  • CORE_PUMPED -- If True, there is dopant in the core.

  • CLAD_PUMPED -- If True, there is dopant in the cladding.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update fiber parameters at each spatial sub-step.

optcom.equations.re_yb module¶

class optcom.equations.re_yb.RE2Levels(N_T, gamma_10, R_p, W_E10, W_A01)¶

Bases: optcom.equations.abstract_equation.AbstractEquation

Implement the 2-level rate equations.

Notes

\[\begin{split}\begin{split} \frac{\partial N_0}{\partial t} &= +\gamma_{10} N_1 - R_p + W_{E,10} N_1 - W_{A,01} N_0\\ \frac{\partial N_1}{\partial t} &= -\gamma_{10} N_1 + R_p - W_{E,10} N_1 + W_{A,01} N_0 \end{split}\end{split}\]

In the case of 2-level rate equations in steady state (\(\frac{\partial N}{\partial t}=0\)), considering that \(N_0 + N_1 = N_T\) an analytical solution is feasible:

\[\begin{split}\begin{split} N_0 = \frac{\gamma_{10}N_1 - R_p + W_{E,10}N_1}{W_{A,01}}\\ N_1 = N_T - N_0 \end{split}\end{split}\]
Parameters

  • N_T --

  • gamma_10 --

  • R_P --

  • W_E10 --

  • W_A01 --

property N_T¶
property R_p¶
property W_A01¶
property W_E10¶
